movie_title: Nudges: The secrets of persuasion ⏲️ 6 Minute English
introduction: Nudges are something that governments and other companies use to persuade us and influence our behav

vocabulary.definition: a subtle way of altering human behavior
vocabulary.example: Supermarkets nudge customers to buy healthier snacks by placing them at eye level.

vocabulary.definition: to treat someone as if they were a child
vocabulary.example: The strict rules at the office can sometimes infantilize the employees.

vocabulary.definition: preferring to make decisions for other people rather than letting them take responsibility
vocabulary.example: The government's decision to ban certain foods can be seen as paternalistic.
The neglected alley was filled with manky garbage bags.

vocabulary.definition: the ability to make your own decisions rather than being controlled by others
vocabulary.example: Having autonomy in the workplace can lead to higher job satisfaction.

vocabulary.definition: making a profit or likely to make money
vocabulary.example: The company decided to invest in the most profitable option to maximize their earnings.
